intro: Krapfia ranunculina, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a flowering plant native to eastern and southern Africa. It is a member of the Ranunculaceae family, characterized by its showy, yellow flowers and palmate leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along streams. Its flowers bloom in early spring, and it produces small, brown seeds that are dispersed by wind. Krapfia ranunculina is often found in mountainous regions and is adapted to cool, humid climates.
